steps: 4 mmol of TAA and 2 mmol of SnCl4·5H2O were dissolved in 80 mL of absolute ethanol by stirring for 30 min.
The mixture solution was transferred to a Teflon-lined stainless-steel autoclave and heated at 160 °C for 12 h.
After naturally cooling to room temperature, the SnS2 was obtained through washing, centrifugation, and drying at 60 °C.
20 mmol of Cd(NO3)2·4H2O were combined with 60 mL of ethylenediamine and stirred until a transparent solution formed.
60 mmol of thiourea was added to the solution and magnetically stirred for 30 min.
The mixture solution was added to a Teflon-lined stainless-steel autoclave and heated at 160 °C for 12 h.
The CdS was obtained through washing, centrifugation, and drying at 60 °C.
x mmol (x = 2, 4, 6, and 8) of the previously synthesized CdS precursor sample were dispersed in 80 mL of absolute ethanol using ultrasonic agitation for 15 min.
A mixture consisting of 2 mmol of SnCl4·5H2O and 4 mmol of TAA was added to the suspension and stirred at room temperature for 30 min.
The mixture solution was added to a Teflon-lined stainless-steel autoclave and heated at 160 °C for 12 h.
The as-prepared samples were obtained through washing, centrifugation, and drying at 60 °C.
0.5 g CdS and 0.5 g SnS2 were combined with 50 mL of deionized water, followed by sonication for a duration of 2 h.

steps: Sourcing commercial PZT ceramic discs (SP-6 grade).
Coating both sides of PZT discs with silver paste via screen printing.
Firing the screen-printed PZT discs at approximately 800°C in air.
Coating Ni wear plates with silver using DC sputtering.
Heating the silver-coated Ni wear plate in flowing hydrogen gas at 700°C for 2 hours to facilitate silver diffusion into nickel.
Applying an additional silver coating on the Ni wear plate (total thickness ~9 μm).
Applying 1 μm thick silver coating over the screen-printed silver layer on the PZT disc using DC magnetron sputtering (Cases 1 & 2).
Removing the screen-printed silver coating and applying ~10 μm silver (Cases 3 & 4).
Heating the disc to 800°C after each 3 μm layer of silver deposition.
Applying a load of 1 MPa, evacuating the vessel, and then applying a final load of 20 MPa.
Maintaining the components under pressure for 1 hour and cooling to room temperature.
Subjecting PZT discs to thermal cycles between 250°C and room temperature at a rate of 3°C/hour.
Holding at 250°C for 2 hours and furnace cooling.
Repoling PZT discs bonded at 400°C using a DC poling unit at 150°C for 15 minutes.
Immersing PZT discs during repoling in dry silicone oil.
Applying a DC potential of 15 kV during repoling.
Laser welding nickel wear plate to nickel housing of transducer.
Brazing stainless-steel wire to electrode contact plate and copper conductor of MI cable.
Laser welding sheath of MI cable to stainless-steel bush and cover plate.

steps: Dissolve Ta2O5, CH3COOLi·2H2O, and C4H6O6 separately in ethanol.

Mix sample powder with PVDF and conductive carbon black in an 8:1:1 wt ratio.
Grind the blend and disperse in NMP to form a homogeneous slurry.
Coat the slurry evenly onto aluminum foil and dry at 100 °C for 10 h.
Cut the dried foils into circular discs of 8 mm diameter.

steps: Accurately weigh the raw materials according to the stoichiometric ratio.

Calcine the dried powder at 1250 °C for 5 hours.
Ball-mill the calcined powder again for 12 hours.
Press the ball-milled powder into a desired size and shape by a cold isostatic press machine at 30 MPa for 15 minutes.

Coat the ceramic plate with silver paste on both sides.

The oxide powders were mixed with alcohol in a 1:1 ratio via wet-milling for 24 h.

steps: Dissolve 0.011 mol Bi(NO3)3 and 0.01 mol Fe(NO3)3·9 H2O in 100 mL deionized water.
Add 3 mL of 68% nitric acid to the bismuth nitrate solution during stirring until dissolved.
Mix the bismuth and iron nitrate solutions.
Add 0.02 mol triammonium citrate and stir for 30 min.
Stir the mixture at 90°C until water evaporates, forming a gel.
Calcine the gel at 550°C for 2 h to obtain BFO powder.
Add 10 mL of 0.3 M cadmium chloride solution to 50 mL of 0.1 M sodium citrate solution and stir for 20 min.
Add 3 mL of 28% concentrated ammonia and 10 mL of 0.6 M thiourea solution sequentially.
React the mixture in a water bath at 60°C for 2.5 h.
Cool, centrifuge, rinse with deionized water and anhydrous ethanol, and dry at 60°C to obtain CdS nanosheets.
Weigh 0.6 g BFO into 60 mL of 0.1 M sodium citrate solution.
Add 1.38 mL of 0.3 M cadmium chloride solution (10 wt% of BFO) and stir for 3 h.
Slowly add 3.6 mL of 28% concentrated ammonia and 1.38 mL of 0.9 M thiourea solution.
React at 60°C in a water bath for 2.5 h.
Collect the precipitate, rinse with deionized water and anhydrous ethanol, and dry at 60°C to obtain 10% CdS/BiFeO3 (BC10).
Increase the cadmium chloride and thiourea solution volumes to obtain 20% CdS/BiFeO3 (BC20) and 30% CdS/BiFeO3 (BC30).
For film preparation, add 0.010 g of sample and 5 mL of rosinol to a centrifuge tube and sonicate for 120 min.
Dropwise add 200 μL of the suspension onto ITO glass and stainless steel sheets (area 1.5 cm²).
Dry the suspension at 240°C to obtain BFO, BC10, BC20, BC30, and CdS films.

steps: Milling of Bi2O3 and TiO2 powders using an agate mortar and pestle.

Treatment of shrimp shells in a 10% w/v sodium hydroxide solution to remove proteins.
Treatment with hydrochloric acid to remove calcium and obtain chitin.
Washing and drying to produce chitin flakes.
Deacetylation of chitin flakes in a 45% w/v sodium hydroxide solution in an autoclave.
Dissolving chitosan flakes in a 2% acetic acid solution.
Neutralizing with 1N NaOH to pH 8.
Washing and drying to obtain pure chitosan.
Mixing 1 g graphite powder, 1 g NaNO3, and 30 ml concentrated H2SO4, stirring at 100 rpm for 30 min in an ice bath.
Adding 3 g KMnO4 while maintaining the temperature below 12 °C.
Heating to 40 °C and stirring for 2 h.
Adding 50 ml distilled water and stirring at 98 °C for 40 min.
Adding 16 ml H2O2 (50%) and diluting with 260 ml distilled water.
Purifying by centrifugation, washing with 5% HCl and distilled water until neutral pH.
Drying under vacuum at 60 °C to obtain GO.
Dispersing 50 mg GO in 50 mL deionized water and sonicating for 1 h.
Adding 5 mL hydrazine (N2H4) and heating under reflux at 100 °C for 12 h.
Cooling, filtering, washing with deionized water, and drying under vacuum at 60 °C to obtain rGO.
Adding graphene powder into acetic acid solution through ultrasonication for 1 h.
Adding Chitosan powder into the graphene/acetic acid solution and stirring for 6 h at room temperature.
Dispersing BiTO powder in the Chitosan/rGO solution through 30 min of ultrasonication and 30 min of magnetic stirring.
Degassing by ultrasonication for 15 min.
Depositing the solution in Petri dishes and drying for 24 h at 60 °C.
Poling with a 6 kV/mm DC electric field for 15 min.
Aging for 24 h in ambient air.
